body:
@zhangruiskyline When running an MLflow project that logs to the Databricks-hosted MLflow server, your project code must explicitly set a valid experiment name. If you do not explicitly set an experiment, the default value is `0`, which is not a valid experiment id in Databricks.

Please try adding a call to `mlflow.set_experiment(/path/to/workspace/experiment)` in your project's training code and let me know if this resolves your issue.

Thanks, @dbczumar , Yes we have set the experiment as follow.

BTW, also how to we pass around the experiment_id for different part in our code? looks like if we just define experiment_id here, if we try to log_params somewhere else we get error that no experiment_id found

```
if __name__ == "__main__":
    logging.basicConfig(stream=sys.stdout, level=logging.DEBUG)
    params = parse_args(sys.argv)
    exp_id = mlflow.set_experiment('/Users/xxx/myflow_exp1')
    mlflow.start_run(experiment_id=exp_id, run_name="online")
    main(params)
```
@zhangruiskyline Can you provide an example of a `log_param` call in your `main()` method that fails? The `set_experiment` call should automatically set the experiment ID for all subsequent runs.

@dbczumar the code flow is like this

so if experiment_id can not be passed by

```
def main(params):
    # Lots of code
       for key, value in params.items():
        mlflow.log_param(key, value)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    logging.basicConfig(stream=sys.stdout, level=logging.DEBUG)
    params = parse_args(sys.argv)
    exp_id = mlflow.set_experiment('/Users/zhrui@microsoft.com/horizon_DLTS')
    mlflow.start_run(experiment_id=exp_id, run_name="online")
    main(params)
```

@zhangruiskyline After calling `mlflow.set_experiment` within a Python process, all calls to `mlflow.start_run()` should automatically use the experiment you specified. There is no need to explicitly pass `experiment_id` to `start_run()`.

Can you try omitting `experiment_id` from `start_run()` and let me know what happens?

Hi @dbczumar , I got the same error as before 
`mlflow.exceptions.RestException: INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: experiment_id must be set to a non-zero value`

I try to directly run the `some.py -p some.json `and via `mlflow run /myproject/`, but give same error

seems experiment ID is not globally recognized yet, but If I set the experiment right before my para log, it works at least for directly python call.

any clue? or any environment variable I am missing?

@zhangruiskyline My mistake! The target experiment for the MLflow project run is determined before the entrypoint script is executed. Calls to `set_experiment` within the project's training code are ignored.

You should be able to set the `MLFLOW_EXPERIMENT_NAME` environment variable before running the project. This will log results to the appropriate experiment. For example:

```
MLFLOW_EXPERIMENT_NAME='/Users/zhrui@microsoft.com/horizon_DLTS' mlflow run /myproject/
```

Can you try this and let me know if it's successful for your use case?

Hi @dbczumar  Thanks for help

with the environment variable set up, I am able to run python script directly successfully without set the experiment ID

but somehow if I run mlflow project, it will need to first create the conda env, and then pip install, and then conda activate, but still failed since we are running in some docker container environment do not have permission to do lots of things.,

 so I wonder if I need to do all those manual step by step, then it seems I can not automation mlflow project. For my use case, I will host mlflow server in Azure databricks, but our training job and some preprocess like spark and normalization python job are all running in a remote SSH connected cluster. Can we define our MLproject and workflow in Azure databricks, andwil ssh to remote training cluster to execute the python or spark script?

what should be best practice here?

Hi @dbczumar 

just want to follow up this one, I still have this problem even after I set experiment ID as environment variable, and run following,

```
name: Same as project folder name

entry_points:
  train:
    command: "python some.py -p some.json"
```

I still get the error like 

`2019/08/27 22:43:12 ERROR mlflow.cli: === Could not find main among entry points ['train'] or interpret main as a runnable script. Supported script file extensions: ['.py', '.sh'] ===`

However, if I directly execute the python script
`python some.py -p some.json`

it will work, not sure what is configuration I am missing? or sth wrong in my project setup? I wonder if we need to have some sort of indent format we need to follow?
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
